data.question: What is the formula for the porous complex prepared with triazine ligand 1 and triphenylene 2?
What yield percentage was obtained for the porous complex 3b?
Which porous complex has acidic phenolic hydroxyl groups mainly directed to pore A?
Is the guest-exchange property of 3b different from that of 3a due to the acidic nature of its pore A?
Does the interatomic distance of OOH···Owater in the pore A of 3b indicate hydrogen bonding?
What is the main reason for the selective uptake of propan-2-ol by pore A in 3b?
data.answer: Hydrogen-bond formation of propan-2-ol with the acidic phenolic hydroxyl group of cartridge 2b via a water molecule

data.question: Did the crystallinity remain intact during the guest exchange for 3b and 3c?
What is the occupancy percentage of the acidic OH groups of 3b directed to pore A?
Are the pores A and B of 3a and 3b both hydrophobic?
What is the expected application of porous coordination networks with properly modified pores?
Was a water molecule involved in propan-2-ol recognition in 3c?
What is the yield percentage for the porous complex 3f?
Which porous complex was grown from a triple-layered solution?
Is the guest-exchange property of 3b influenced by the polar nature of its pores?
What is the main feature of the porous complex 3d?
What drives the selective uptake of propan-2-ol by pore A in 3b?
data.answer: Hydrogen bonding with phenolic OH groups

data.question: Did the use of cartridge 2c afford another porous complex with acidic phenolic hydroxyl groups?
What is the significance of the interatomic distances of OOH···Owater and Owater···Opropan-2-ol in 3b?
data.answer: They indicate the formation of hydrogen bonds

data.question: What is the yield percentage for the porous complex 3e?
Is the modular synthesis approach used in the preparation of various biporous networks?
